main event: Aerial sightings of a single object which was round, silver-white and brilliantly lit were reported in Wethersfield, Essex, England on October 6 and 7, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared to explode on October 6 but continued moving with less brilliance until it faded from view,There were numerous CIA observations along with the visual sighting,The observations included numerous targets the size of B-36 and L-20 aircraft,The evaluation suggested the object was probably a balloon,The sightings were reported during nights with no unusual weather.
sighted object: single round, silver-white brilliantly lit object
witness description: Visual and numerous CIA observations from military sources
